context: The word 'lepakko' in Finnish means 'bat'. It refers to the flying mammal. The word declines based on grammatical case, as shown in the dictionary definition, with different forms for singular and plural, nominative, genitive, partitive, etc.  The suffix '-kko' is a common noun ending in Finnish. There are also possessive forms indicating who owns the bat (my bat, your bat, our bats, etc.).
